name: Jon
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The renovation on this eclectic property was very nicely done. Unique custom dual stone shower and antique copper bath tub were an awesome touch. Property was immaculate and well maintained. Really appreciated the excellent wifi and dual TV's with Roku and cable for free. King size bed was very comfortable. This property would be great for couples and also comfortably sleeps four with a sleeper sofa in the family room. Sliding interior barn doors separating spaces was kinda cool, but could be a detractor if maximum privacy is desired. Downtown Payson is pretty industrial and there's not much within walking distance. Property was quiet and peaceful, despite being on main street. Not much to do on site. Would highly recommend for a quiet getaway or as a jumping off spot to do other activities. Strongly suggest having own transportation as public transit is almost non-existant in Payson.

We wanted to get away from the city fireworks and we didn't hear one firework the entire night which was great because my dogs hate them. The bed was comfortable, the kitchen had everything we needed, and I could sign into my Hulu account to watch movies. The place was spotless and there were so many comfy places to sit outside and read a book. The jacuzzi was really nice. I loved how the cabin was in the city so we can zip down to Walmart but it still felt secluded. I'll definitely be back!

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Cute place to get away. The lake mentioned is a "manmade" lake made with reclaimed waste water so if you're expecting to go swimming or entertaining your water pets, this description is misleading. There is no swimming in this small lake. People do fish in it but I can't imagine they are fishing to eat reclaimed waste water fish.
Also, I would imagine that an airbnb would have a small washer and dryer especially for pets (accidents and such) but this place doesn't have such. it was inconvenient and we ended up washing our rags by hand in the tub and hanging them to dry outside.
The shower has zero water pressure. If you like extra long showers here is your chance to enjoy them!
And the neighbor (who is virtually 50 ft away) has a large dog that barked ALL NIGHT LONG. 10pm, 1am, 3am.
While the place is cute, has a musty smell of antiquity, and has its moments of peace, we found these mishaps of negatives almost outweighed the good parts. Wish we had a better experience for our anniv.

review_text:
This cottage was cute and as described.
Lots of little touches that make it feel like home.
Nicely stocked with kcups, teas, toiletries and comfy soft throw blankets.
Perfect for a short stay. No laundry to be done here- No washing machine. Which was ok for a 2 nite stay.
There were a few things;
The hanging lights out front had a few bulbs that were out, the door locks were mentioned in another recent review, but we felt safe.
In a prior review Someone also mentioned stained carpet, we did not see that. The cottage was clean and spider web free.
Our only disappointment was the shower. Water did not come out of the shower head. It was after 6p on the weekend when we discovered this. I notified the owner who were sorry, but stated they would not be able to get a plumber out at that time.
We did have running hot water to bathe, just not standing in shower.
Overall great spot, cute clean private cottage.
Thank you !

review_text: This was our 3rd annual stay at Cynthia's cottage. Once again, everything was great - clean, well stocked, comfortable and great location. We did something new and recommend it. Take a tour of the Zane Grey replica house and museum which is just across the road from the cottage. Allow yourself at least 2 hours. We didn't so will return to complete our tour next year. The museum has a lot of interesting history of the Payson and surrounding area. We also went to the nearbyTonto Bridge State Park which was incredible. We hiked down to the waterfalls and bridge entrance, but you can also walk along from the parking lot and access observation areas without a challenging hike up and down the steep areas.

Inside, the couch, bed and all the furniture are colorful, fun, and luxurious. It has a cute loft upstairs with two single beds, should someone have kids. This Airbnb is even fabulous after the sun goes down. It has a hot tub on the deck perfect for watching the stars, which glimmer brightly because there is no light pollution. I booked this place so my friends could celebrate their 30th wedding anniversary and they said they would remember it forever. What an absolutely fantastic place. Well worth every penny spent.

I cannot wait to bring my husband and dog up to Lesley's chalet in the future. I would absolutely recommend Lesley's chalet if you are looking for amazing getaway in Payson!

review_text: Had a fantastic stay at the Chalet! The photos don't do it justice! The cabin was much bigger than we initially thought. Beautiful location, just a few steps away from the east verde river, nestled in the bottom of a valley surrounded by trees. Check-in was simple and easy. Be sure to take screenshots of the check-in instructions because we did not have cell service at the cabin (however it was not an issue because once checked-in, the cabin has fantastic wifi!) The cabin has everything you could need. Watching the stars from the hot tub on the deck was definitely the highlight of the stay. The area is quite and peaceful and the location is great, only about 12 minutes from Payson. The property is easily accessed from a paved road. No need to bring firewood as there is a wonderful electric fireplace. Wish we could have stayed longer! If you're looking for a cabin with unique charm in a peaceful location, you have to try out this beautiful property!

review_text: Lesley is a 5-star host, and her Payson, AZ Chalet was absolutely the perfect place for our Thanksgiving week getaway. Nestled in a private community on the East Verde River, we enjoyed the moon and stars from the hot tub on the deck. The quiet of the high desert surroundings gave us the welcome feeling of solitude with the comfort of being within the friendly Payson East Verde River neighborhood enclave. Our stay was the perfect blend of crisp, cold nights and pleasant late Fall sunny days. The city of Payson is only a ten-minute drive and is big enough to provide every service needed. The Chalet is cozy with beautiful knotty pine interior walls, a full-service kitchen, an excellent shower with a jacuzzi tub, and an overall comfortable, homey feeling. The hot tub was the draw for us, and it did not disappoint - hot, clean, and with a colored light show! The only thing I would mention to future renters is it would be a difficult stay for those with accessibility issues.

The location is close enough to Payson, but far enough away that you feel like you're out in nature, yet you also aren't all alone in the woods. My girls enjoyed walking down to explore the river, too.
There is no cell service but the wifi worked great. We enjoyed star gazing at night on the porch, with no light pollution it was just gorgeous, so many stars! We got to see the lunar eclipse and it was amazing.
Overall we had a great time and would definitely stay here again!

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
Â·
October 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Iâ€™m not one to write reviews however after our experience with this â€œchaletâ€ and its owner, you need to be aware on what you are getting yourself into while staying here.
Shortly after arriving on a Friday evening, we had dinner on the patio with some of our family (my wifeâ€™s 2 sisters) that were camping near by. As the owners live in the house below the property, we watched them drive by slowly, twice, during the course of our meal. Our family was only there for dinner however I was later questioned about our â€œunregistered guestsâ€
After waking up the next morning, me and my wife had several bug bites on us. We thought they were from our time spent outside however we have a 1 year old baby, and after her morning nap in the master bed, when we went in to wake her up we found 2 bed bugs on the lampshade next to the bed.
After pulling the sheets back, we got photos and videos of almost a dozen live bed bugs crawling around and pockets of old eggs around the bed. After removing our belongings and leaving the property, we went online to let the owner know and we found a previous review from 2 months prior letting the owners know about the problem.
Instead of waking through her yard and up to the house to investigate the review, she just disregarded the review and told them she didnâ€™t believe them.
If someone had actually changed the sheets on the bed we slept in, thereâ€™s no chance they didnâ€™t see the several pockets of bed bugs and eggs around the mattress.
2 days after our stay, the bites on my wife were getting much worse so she went to urgent care to get help with them. She was then informed that the bites were infected and was advised to go to the ER to be treated. After going to the ER, they confirmed that the bites were infected and counted 38 bites, all from the same type of bugâ€¦after a few miserable days of dealing with almost 40 infected bug bites all over her body, while on an antibiotic cycle, my wife is starting to recover.
The owner did confirm with me that they replaced the mattress and treated the room, however if they think this infestation is solely isolated to the bedroom, it is laughable...

According to the previous review warning about bed bugs OVER 2 MONTHS AGO, with how many (adult) bugs and eggs we found, thereâ€™s not a chance this entire little home isnâ€™t infested as it is lined with old, cloth decor.
We booked this stay to enjoy our anniversary weekend in some fresh air, however it was quickly turned into the worst traveling experience we have ever had. Not only our lost costs for the vacation and time off, but the medical bills that we now have from this.
Between the help AirBnb has â€œprovidedâ€, and the way the owner has handled this situation, we will never use this platform again.
DO NOT STAY HERE.
Donâ€™t say I didnâ€™t warn youâ€¦
Iâ€™ve heard VRBO is a better platform anyway.

review_text: The chalet is a charming, unique, very quiet vacation get away, located conveniently between Payson and Pine. If you like to hike, bird watch, see the sites, then this is the place! The chalet is equipped with all the modern amenities and the beds are very comfortable. We loved sitting on the deck! The chalet is small so probably only fits up to four people comfortably. Also, due to the stairs and elevated tub/shower, I would not recommend for people with mobility issues. Lesley remained in contact with us and even recommended a variety of restaurants and sites to view.

review_text:
Lesleyâ€™s place was in a perfect location and almost exactly what we were hoping to find when booking this air b n b. I say â€œalmostâ€ only because we were traveling with a 9 month old and as anyone can imagine, being out of a normal routine and space can be difficult for a baby. Lesley was very honest when hearing that we were traveling with our baby by telling us the only place a pack n play would fit well was the master bedroom- very true! It was the darkest room with just enough space to fit it. The problem we had was trying to climb into bed ourselves once our baby was asleep- the floor creeks a little and so does the bed- all a perfect recipe to wake the little one up. We ended up sleeping in the two twin beds upstairs, which were really comfortable, and gave the master to our 9 month old! Definitely a trip to remember!
Lesley communicated with us from start to finish and was such a pleasure to rent from. Sheâ€™s honest, fair, and has such a beautiful property. Coming from Chandler, AZ, this was the perfect distance for a quick get away and loved being outdoors in great weather and nice walks along the creek (which Lesley helped us find an appropriate short cut to get there). We are hoping to come back again soon!
Thank you Lesley for making our stay during our anniversary trip a memorable one!

This was a wonderful stay at a very unique 1934 cabin. Description is accurate and the inside is beautifully updated as the pictures show. Easy to use kitchen with all amenities. The master shower is a nice spa like experience, that was most enjoyable. We happened to be there during the countrywide heat wave, and the AC never skipped a beat. It is set automatically to adjust to a Very Comfortable temp., no need to ever touch it. Easy walking distance to the Green Vally park (even though we didnâ€™t, due to the heat wave). We even got to catch the concert in the park held on Sat. nights. Try not miss this, itâ€™s great family fun with music everyone will enjoy.
The only issue we had was, the back door (handle specifically) was locked by mistake. Causing the door not to open when entering the code provided.
But, we sent a message to Boyd and within the hour he responded with a quick solution. Yay!! So please be sure NOT to touch the door knob lock. The dead bolt is all you need.
Thank you Boyd, for a wonderful stay!!Weâ€™ll be sure to stay here again the next time we come to Payson.

The local museum with Zane Grey cabin is right there also. There are at least 10 thrift stores within walking distance which were fun to explore. We will try to stay here again.

review_text: This place was great over all, and then some! Everything you need was available. I brought many "little" things that my family and I personally wanted to have like ear plugs, lighter for the fireplace and fire pit, and roasting sticks. But we didn't need to because Boyd's place had it all! I was very impressed with all the thoughtful extras in addition to the main amenities. We had an issue with something being found by my 3 year old that was left behind from someone that could have been a serious issue but thankfully wasn't too bad. I wish we would have been reimbursed the cleaning fee for that issue but I'm confident they will push for more diligence in cleaning going forward so it doesn't happen to anyone else. My husband left his beloved hat when we left and Boyd is making arrangements for us to get it back which is also very appreciated. Again, overall a fantastic place and we would stay again.

The AC wasnâ€™t working properly and George offered to send someone to fix it the following day. Because it wasnâ€™t too hot yet and he supplied fan we declined. name: Randall
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2024
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Wife and I really enjoyed the place. It's very modern and clean inside. Easy entry - a key point as lots of places in hilly Payson have steep driveways and entrance stairs - this one has level parking and two steps up and in. Comfy beds and furniture. Convenient to many area stores and restaurants in Payson. Nice quiet neighborhood. Great appliances and lots of staples you often don't find in rentals- oil and spices, not to mention a K cup coffee maker with lots of supplies. Weather wasn't great during our March stay, so didn't get to enjoy the pleasant front porch but once, nor the backyard. Charming electric fireplace that has a nice heat setting. Our only negative - the furnace is loud when it's running. We learned to adapt by turning up heat before bedtime, then turning way down(nice Nest thermostat) so it wouldn't kick in again until 3-4 am. This worked well during a chilly week in March- nighttime temps in low-mid 30's.

Geroge,
Thank you for hosting us. Thank you for being so accommodating and creating a wonderful space for our family to stay in while getting out of the city. Your home made us all feel SAFE and honestly the security cameras were what did that for me personally... Having small little children, we never are able to sleep with the windows or doors open but at your property we were all able to sleep with the house open so we could breathe the fresh air. Thanks to your security cameras, which I feel is what usually deters anyone who would have malicious intent. The patio was the best part, your home is to die for. All the decor and little touches made the home even that much better. You had the best channels on TV and the bedding is so soft very luxurious & the fans in the closet for some extra air flow during the days was absolutely perfection. We will be staying again and appreciate YOU making our FIRST air bnb stay the best ever. God Bless You!

review_text: My family and I enjoyed our stay at BellaRina Log Cabin! The fenced in yard was perfect for my two grandchildren. The firepit was very enjoyable in the evenings to roast hot dogs and marshmallows. We ate our evening meals outside at the table with plenty of chairs for everyone. The kitchen was well-equipped for cooking. The bathroom was clean and spacious. We all slept great in the three bedrooms. The cabin has a rustic feel with all the comforts of home! We enjoyed a couple of outings to Green Valley Park where we walked around the lake and fished and Rumsey Park where the kids played on the playground. It was nice having a place near town for some last minute runs to Walmart. Catherine is an excellent host and always responds quickly. We all decided that we want to come back to BellaRina again!

review_text: This cabin was the perfect place for a last-minute need to be in Payson to help family. We were there during extreme heat and never even adjusted the two AC units. Very comfortable, very quiet and you are just on the edge of town so easy to get anything you need. And we saw elk nearly every night.

Stayed with kids
review_text: Overall the place was really nice. The lockbox for the key was a bit of a challenge, might be that the numbers weren't very large and I didn't have my glasses! All interior surfaces were clean (i.e. the counters, floors, furniture). After being there and seeing the photos again, the kitchen is a bit small (lack of counter space). The furniture inside was all very comfy. Even though there is only one bathroom, it was pretty big. A/C is in the dining room and master bedroom, that doesn't quite make it too the living room, bathroom or other bedrooms. That said, being were were there during one of the hottest weeks of the year, it wasn't bad in the other rooms during the day. The 3rd bedroom had a swamp cooler that wasn't working during our stay. The yards were huge and fenced (both front and back, each separate but accessible to each other). The outdoor furniture took us 20 minutes or so to cleanup all the cobwebs. This is a country cabin setting, expect animal noises.

review_text: I don't usually write reviews, but I need to on this one. This cabin far exceeded my expectations. Absolutely beautiful, roomy and immaculate! Everything was provided. Gated, HUGE, front and back yards! Was perfect for our dog! I was hesitate getting a cabin "in town", but it's secluded and feels like you're in the forest. Had elk in our front yard every morning! Located in Payson, brings traveling to the store a breeze. Close to many hiking trails (we hit 3 of them). Our host, Catherine, was easy to communicate with, very prompt replies (very prompt!), and courteous. JoEllen, the property manger, lives next door and is super friendly. You won't find this much cabin for the value! An absolute must! Great stay!!!! 5 stars for sure!

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Christopher was proactive in letting me know about the winter road conditions which was appreciated. He was very responsive.
As other reviews have mentioned, download a map or instructions to the cabin as once you get out of town there is little to almost zero cell phone service. Also, keep in mind this cabin is somewhat remote, so if there is snow, you will almost likely need a vehicle that is capable of driving in the snow or on snowpack.
The cabin itself was cozy and the decor was unique and nicely done. This was a perfect place for a weekend getaway with my pets. The property is fenced in completely. The deck was great for enjoying a morning cup of coffee and gazing at the bright stars at night.
Overall, this cabin is a very peaceful place. I would recommend staying here, and I would absolutely stay here again.

The pines surrounding the yard were so peaceful and it sort of felt like youâ€™re up in a tree house which was so cool. Waking up and having coffee in the crisp weather, sitting in the rocking chair while listening to the river roaring in the distance was truly what I loved most. Walking in the river with my dogs is a close second though. We walked around the river a few times throughout our stay and loved it more each time! Listening to the water was so healing for the soul. The record player was such a cool vibe, and I was obsessed with the lava lamp and salt rocks! The decor was so cute and the kitchen had the cutest vintage modern touches. We will definitely be back!

Stayed with a pet
review_text: Matterhorn is a really cool place to stay. The neighborhood is lovely and the house is cozy and welcoming. Nice little touches around the house include coffee and k-cup pods, fresh fruit, candies, creamers and soft drinks as well as spices and kitchen necessities. The livingroom/kitchen area is a comfy place to hang out. We brought our doggies bed and he had a relaxing stay also. Everything you need is right there! Beds are firm and comfortable with quality linens and pillows. We ate at our favorite local restaurant, Duza's Kitchen, 3 times during our 2 night stay. Everything in Payson is just minutes from this chalet including shopping, dining and outdoor activities. Super easy to find and park. We met up with friends from the valley (and we are from the White Mountains) for a birthday celebration. It was a perfect 1/2 way point. We will be back for sure!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Close to the main intersection of Payson in a safe quiet neighborhood. Check-in was a breeze and the place was clean and warmly lit for our arrival. Welcome snacks and water were a great touch. They also offered a few board games and coloring for littles. Towels seemed new as did the bedding. Host had great communication. The second bathroom was very convenient. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would pick this over a hotel in town every time. Great place!
